image.altText: Anthony Albanese with his chin up and Benjamin Netanyahu with his mouth slightly open. Flags behind each

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu have both been chastised over their "war of words" by one of Australia's central Jewish community groups, following the announcement Australia would recognise Palestine next month.

title.children: Jewish group chastises Albanese and Netanyahu's 'war of words'

image.altText: Composite image between Bruce Lehrmann and Lisa Wilkinson.

props.synopsis: Bruce Lehrmann's bid to overturn a finding that he raped his former colleague Brittany Higgins has not started smoothly, with Federal Court judges questioning the logic of his grounds of appeal.

title.children: 'I don't understand': Logic of Bruce Lehrmann's appeal bid questioned by judges

image.altText: Mark Butler speaking at the National press club

props.synopsis: The NDIS has transformed the lives of its participants, but hard questions about the scheme's future are again being asked. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: The new $2b plan to divert kids with autism, developmental delay off NDIS

image.altText: Dressed in a three-piece suit and tie, Oliver Schulz carries a coat on his arm, looking serious outside court.

props.synopsis: A former special forces trooper will be the first Australian soldier to stand trial for a war crime, more than 13 years after he shot dead a villager in an Afghan field.

title.children: Former SAS trooper to be first Australian soldier to face war crime trial

image.altText: A woman at a table looking at her AI companion on her phone.

props.synopsis: Hayley's AI companion is credited with changing her life but for others they can be used for sex or even convey sinister overtones, Raising questions over whether the industry needs regulation.

title.children: 'A relationship she might not have had': How Hayley's AI partner changed her life

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with toys.

props.synopsis: The 29 childcare centres were the first issued with compliance actions over ongoing failures to meet quality standards, following laws passed by parliament last month.

title.children: Names released of 29 failing childcare centres at risk of losing funding

image.altText: Childrens toys including a giraffe inside a car and an abacus.

props.synopsis: Victoria's childcare regulators are failing to keep kids safe due to poor information sharing, legal constraint, chronic underfunding and a system that places the privacy of educators and the pursuit of profits over child safety, a rapid review has found.

title.children: Victoria to overhaul childcare safety after damning rapid review

image.altText: Air Asia X plane close up

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on the federal government to strengthen consumer protections in the aviation sector after a budget airline left travellers stranded and out of pocket when it abruptly cancelled services to a popular holiday destination.

title.children: Budget airline AirAsia cuts popular tourist route out of Australia

image.altText: A woman sits in her home, being interviewed

props.synopsis: A patient caught up in the immense pressure being placed on WA hospitals says her planned surgery being cancelled has put her under significant stress and eroded her trust in the health system.

title.children: Patient whose surgery cancelled after 350-day wait 'inconsolable'

image.altText: two men in suits

props.synopsis: Josh Willie will take over as Tasmanian Labor leader, a day after former leader Dean Winter moved an unsuccessful no-confidence motion in the Liberal government of Jeremy Rockliff.

title.children: Josh Willie replaces Dean Winter as Tasmanian Labor leader

image.altText: Raelene Cooper walking in a crowd outside the Federal Court in Sydney, wearing headphones and carrying a coffee cup.

props.synopsis: Raelene Cooper has taken the federal environment minister to court to over a 2022 application to protect Indigenous rock art that is yet to be resolved.

title.children: Traditional owner wants WA rock art decision next month

image.altText: Aerial view of a wrapped bouquet and assorted stuffed toys lain on dirt next to a drain.

props.synopsis: Police are combing through CCTV and forensic evidence as they search for the mother of a newborn baby whose body was found in a stormwater drain on Monday.

title.children: Police following new leads after baby's body found in drain

image.altText: Map showing the Bureau of Meteorology's forecast total rainfall, with large area in orange. Label with Friday, 11pm, rain cloud.

props.synopsis: ABC News Breakfast weather presenter Nate Byrne says it's looking "pretty wild" on either end of the map in the coming days.

title.children: Wild weather forecast for Sydney, Brisbane and Perth

image.altText: Melania Trump looking to her right while wearing a white coat and top, standing in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Throughout history, first ladies have been designated with traditional female roles. But they also have a long tradition of speaking out on key political issues.

title.children: Melania Trump's peace letter to Vladimir Putin was a display of soft power

image.altText: The childcare centre with police tape.

props.synopsis: The man who smashed his way into a childcare centre, sending staff and children into lockdown, had multiple convictions for drug, stalking, and weapon offences.

title.children: Sunshine Coast childcare centre intruder on parole at time of death

image.altText: Izak Rankine running with the ball, looking for a teammate to kick to in an AFL match.

props.synopsis: The AFL grants Adelaide's request for more time to respond to the league's "proposed determinations" over an alleged homophobic slur by Crows star Izak Rankine.

title.children: AFL gives Crows more time to respond as Rankine decision drags on

image.altText: Andrew Larcos with his dad at a restaurant by the water

props.synopsis: From having to give up a job, to feeling like life is on hold, readers share the challenges and guilt around caring for an aging parent.

title.children: 'Hardest thing I've done': Readers on caring for an aging parent

image.altText: Three people walking, wide shot. Woman in black long sleeve and khaki skirt to left. Two men to her right in shirt and tie.

props.synopsis: An employee and friend of Matt Wright has denied accusations he told "blatant lies" during the celebrity crocodile wrangler's trial in order to protect him.

title.children: Matt Wright's friend asked if he 'understands what perjury is'

image.altText: Front part of a silver Ferrari parked in a garage.

props.synopsis: More than $18 million dollars worth of drugs is taken off the streets of Western Australia, as methamphetamine use skyrockets across the state.

title.children: Ferrari, 40 kilograms of meth seized in WA organised crime crackdown

image.altText: A man dressed in hospital scrubs and a bandanna holds a baby which has its face blurred.

props.synopsis: Perth obstetrician Rhys Bellinge pleads guilty in court to the manslaughter of 24-year-old Elizabeth Pearce after ploughing into the car she was a passenger in earlier this year.

title.children: Doctor who had 'aggression to the world' admits killing woman in car crash

image.altText: An underground scene showing a wall of coal and mining machinery.

props.synopsis: Peabody Energy has terminated a deal to buy five Anglo American coal mines in the Bowen Basin citing an underground ignition at the Moranbah North mine in March.

title.children: $5.7 billion, five coal mine deal termination sparks arbitration

image.altText: dozens of make shift tents on dirt land with destroyed buildings behind them.

props.synopsis: By stitching together the so-called "evacuation orders" issued by the Israel Defense Forces, it is possible to see just how much of Gaza Israel has already taken.

title.children: The maps that reveal how Gazans have almost nowhere left to go

image.altText: Three people walking on a beach.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese says he does not want to "get into semantics" over categorising South Australia's devastating algal bloom as a national disaster but will "provide support as requested".

title.children: PM won't 'get into semantics' over declaring algal bloom a national disaster

image.altText: Natasha Stott Despoja has short blonde hair, she wears a blue blazer, standing outside in sunshine. She holds a purple report.

props.synopsis: Corporal punishment including smacking has been used as an excuse for "awful abuse" and should be outlawed, a royal commissioner says.

title.children: SA royal commission recommends a ban on smacking children

image.altText: Daryl Maguire wearing a blue suit and tie

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Daryl Maguire has been handed a jail sentence of 10 months for giving misleading evidence to the NSW corruption watchdog.

title.children: Disgraced former MP jailed for giving 'clearly misleading' evidence at ICAC

image.altText: A photo of The Gap near Albany, WA

props.synopsis: Albany police tell an inquest into the likely suicide of a 24-year-old man at The Gap, on WA's South Coast, that a support line at the location may help reduce the potential for further deaths.

title.children: Coroner backs calls for mental health hotline at suicide hotspot

image.altText: A white woman with brown hair touches the side of her face as she poses for a photo

props.synopsis: Actor Aubrey Plaza speaks for the first time about the sudden death of her husband, Jeff Baena, saying her life has become a daily struggle.

title.children: 'Daily struggle': Aubrey Plaza speaks about husband's death

image.altText: Man and woman in suits sign paperwork

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth has agreed to contribute just under half the cost of building the 2032 Olympic Games venues, under a deal struck with the Queensland government.

title.children: State and federal governments agree on venue plan for Brisbane 2032 Games

image.altText: aerial image of ambulances treating a patient after a shooting at Parramatta on Sunday, May 25, 2025

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old has been charged for the part he allegedly played in the fatal shooting of a Sydney underworld figure while his car was stopped at traffic lights earlier this year.

title.children: Teen charged over fatal shooting of Sydney underworld figure

image.altText: A pile of bricks and rubbish between a fence and a shed.

props.synopsis: After relying on a buyer's agent for expert advice, a "blindsided" Sydney couple discovers their investment property has costly hidden problems.

title.children: Investors issue warning on buyer's agents after costly property blunder

image.altText: A sign marks The Wesley Hospital.

props.synopsis: Rosemarie Campbell, who died three days after having gastric bypass surgery, was described as a dedicated grandmother during a coronial inquest into her death in Brisbane.

title.children: Patient told husband she thought surgery was 'mistake' before death

image.altText: Bernard Tomic hits a double-handed backhand shot during a tennis match, wears a green tee, black shorts and cap on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: Bernard Tomic is one of six Australians to win their opening match of qualification for the US Open.

title.children: Tomic turns back clock to advance in US Open qualifiers

image.altText: People pose around a man with a clapboard

props.synopsis: James J Robinson has photographed the likes of Rihanna and Kylie Jenner but his debut feature film deals with issues close to the Filipino-Australian filmmakers's heart.

title.children: First Light is an inquiry into faith and corruption through a nun's eyes
